reviews: Bokan is a 3 level rooftop bar, with a view over whole London, from the City. The atmosphere is relaxed and cheerful, there is live music and friendly service. The prices are very reasonable and it is just a perfect start for a Friday night! There is also an outside area where you can sunbath, and smoking is permitted there. There are also heaters to be able to enjoy it when it is cold. All in all, a fantastic place, perfect to start the weekend at!

I would much prefer just being able to pick up my drink from the main bar. I have stayed in the attached hotel and had breakfast up here too which was excellent (and much more peaceful).

After the lovely reviews and some research I visited Bokan Bar with my wife and her parents for NYE. I must say that the staff absolutely ruined the experience. There was a private section reserved for staff and presumably VIP guests on the side of the fire works. At midnight some people moved the boundary and walked in to the area and we thought that it is open for all guests temporarily while the firework lasts. We walked a few steps inside the area and shortly after a member of staff stepped in front of me and said that I can listen to him or he can call security (3 minutes in the new year). There are levels to how a waiter should communicate to a guest and this is coming from someone who spent years in a high end bar during university years. Threatening to call security should be the last resort and not the first. Sorry but I expected more from a place like this. I appreciate that the area was reserved, but for ¬£50 entry fee I would expect more professionalism in the most memorable moment of the evening. While leaving the venue, we had an interesting experience in the elevator where a member of staff discussed with an escort lady (in Russian) how someone is willing pay ¬£1000 for an evening. I was left extremely embarrassed in front of my wife's parents who had to listen to this conversation. I thought I booked an evening in a classy venue, not a brothel.
